data.title: Singing Guide: Cascada
data.meta_description: Learn to sing like Cascada. Practical tips, vocal techniques, exercises. Vocal technique guide.
data.text:
Cascada is a well-known German dance-pop group consisting of singer Natalie Horler and producers DJ Manian and Yanou. Cascada's music is characterized by its infectious beats, catchy hooks, and electrifying energy.

If you're an aspiring singer looking to learn how to sing like Cascada, here are some tips and resources that can help you achieve your goals:

Vocal Technique

Cascada's music is characterized by Natalie Horler's powerful and emotive vocals, which combine elements of both pop and dance music. To sing like Natalie, it's important to focus on the following techniques:

Breath control: Cascada's music often features long, sustained notes, which require strong breath control. Singing exercises like the Farinelli breathing exercise can be a great way to improve your breath control and stamina.

Pitch accuracy: Cascada's music features a lot of high-energy, danceable melodies that require precise pitch control. Singing exercises like the pitch accuracy test can help improve your ear for pitch and make sure you're hitting the right notes.

Range control: Cascada's music covers a wide range of pitches, and Natalie Horler's vocal range is an impressive 3.5 octaves. To improve your range control, try the vocal range test to determine your own range and then practice exercises like the pitch training game to expand it.

Emotion and expression: Finally, Cascada's music is all about high-energy, infectious emotion. To truly capture the spirit of Cascada's music, focus on expressing emotion through your voice and really putting yourself into your performances.

Songs to Learn

To really get a feel for Cascada's vocal style, it's important to study some of their most iconic songs. Here are a few suggestions:

"Everytime We Touch": This hit song is perhaps Cascada's most famous, and it features soaring vocals and a catchy chorus that's perfect for showcasing your range and breath control.

"What Hurts the Most": Another classic Cascada song, "What Hurts the Most" features emotive, expressive vocals and a driving beat that's sure to get your heart racing.

"Evacuate the Dancefloor": This upbeat, synth-heavy song is all about high-energy dancing and infectious melodies, making it a great choice for practicing your pitch accuracy and vocal control.

"Miracle": Finally, "Miracle" is a slower, ballad-style song that showcases Natalie Horler's emotive vocals and expressive range.

Resources from Singing Carrots

To supplement your learning, Singing Carrots offers a wide range of resources that can help you become a better singer and learn to sing like Cascada:

Use the vocal range test to determine your own vocal range and practice exercises in the pitch training game to improve your range control.

The pitch accuracy test can help you improve your ear for pitch, which is essential for mastering Cascada's catchy melodies.

The singing course is a 21-lesson program that covers singing theory and practical tips, which can help you master advanced singing techniques like breath control and pitch accuracy.

The search songs by vocal range feature allows you to find songs that match your vocal range and genre preference.

Finally, the vocal ranges of famous singers feature on Singing Carrots can help you learn more about Natalie Horler's unique vocal range and how it contributes to her distinctive singing style.

By focusing on developing your vocal technique, studying Cascada's iconic songs, and using the resources available on Singing Carrots, you'll be well on your way to achieving your dreams of singing like Natalie Horler and becoming a true dance-pop sensation.
